com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.mvp.rx

Class MvpRxPresenter<V extends MvpView,M>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.mvp.MvpBasePresenter<V>
      • com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.mvp.rx.MvpRxPresenter<V,M>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MvpPresenter<V>

    public abstract class MvpRxPresenter<V extends MvpView,M>
extends MvpBasePresenter<V>
    A presenter for RxJava, that assumes that only one Observable is subscribed by this presenter. The idea is, that you make your (chain of) Observable and pass it to #subscribe(Observable) . The presenter internally subscribes himself as Subscriber to the observable (which executes the observable). Before subscribing the presenter calls #applyScheduler(Observable) to apply the subscribeOn() and observeOn()
    Since:
    1.1.0

      • applyScheduler

        protected  applyScheduler( observable)
        Called in #subscribe(Observable) to set subscribeOn() and observeOn(). As default it uses AndroidSchedulerTransformer. Override this method if you want to provide your own scheduling implementation.
        Parameters:
        observable - The observable
        Returns:
        the observable with the applied scheduler

      • detachView

        public void detachView(boolean retainInstance)
        Description copied from interface: MvpPresenter
        Will be called if the view has been destroyed. Typically this method will be invoked from Activity.detachView() or Fragment.onDestroyView()
        Specified by:
